clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Television Cartoons in Patients Younger Than 3.5 Years During Echocardiography
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Television Cartoons in Patients Younger Than 3.5 Years During Echocardiography.A Prospective Randomized Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación para el Fomento de la Investigación Sanitaria y Biomédica de la Comunitat Valenciana

clinical_study.source: Fundación para el Fomento de la Investigación Sanitaria y Biomédica de la Comunitat Valenciana

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is analyze the influence of TV entertainment in children less than 3 years of age during echocardiography in order to achieve a complete and accurate test.
This is an experimental study in children with suspected congenital or acquired cardiac disease. An examination room was prepared with a TV on the ceiling that was positioned in a way that would provide unobstructed viewing for children during the echocardiography procedure.

primary_outcome.description: Time used to perform the Echocardiography
The quality of echocardiography (1 poor, 2 medium, 3 high)

secondary_outcome.description: Parents completed a questionnaire about the use of TV during the test
The parent's opinion about the sensation of stress by using a scale from 0 (no stress) to 10 (so much stress

arm_group.description: Animated cartoons with sound were reproduced during the echocardiography
Echocardiography was performed by using the distractions available at the time of test.

intervention.description: TV was connected to display the cartoon video during the echocardiography: the episode number 125 of 'Dora the Explorer': 'Baby Winky Goes Home!' was reproduced during the echocardiography.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients who were referred to pediatric cardiology consultation.
- Patients younger than 3.5 years.
- Signed informed consent by parents.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No signed informed consent by parents.
